author: Amadou Atar
title: Mercato : Timothy Ouma, le prometteur joueur kenyan dans le viseur des Verts
text:
L’AS Saint-Étienne pourrait frapper un joli coup sur le marché des transferts. Le club du Forez serait en pole position pour s’attacher les services de Timothy Ouma, jeune milieu offensif kenyan qui fait sensation en Suède avec l’IF Elfsborg.
À seulement 20 ans, ce talent brut venu d’Afrique de l’Est affole déjà les statistiques en Allsvenskan. Sa vision du jeu et sa technique ont fait de lui l’une des révélations du championnat suédois cette saison. Les recruteurs stéphanois ne s’y sont pas trompés : ils suivent le joueur depuis plusieurs mois et auraient déjà formulé une offre concrète.
« C’est un profil rare« , nous confie une source proche du dossier. « Il allie puissance physiquefra et finesse technique, avec un sens du jeu qui rappelle les grands meneurs africains. » Une comparaison qui n’est pas sans rappeler un certain Yaya Touré, référence du poste sur le continent.
Un transfert à 3,5 millions d’Euros
Le montant du transfert pourrait avoisiner les 3,5 millions d’euros, une somme conséquente pour les Verts mais qui reflète le potentiel du joueur. Le Slavia Prague est également sur les rangs, mais Saint-Étienne garderait une longueur d’avance dans ce dossier.
Formé dans les rues de Nairobi avant de faire ses classes à l’académie Ligi Ndogo, Ouma a explosé depuis son arrivée en Europe. Ses statistiques parlent d’elles-mêmes : plus de 85% de passes réussies cette saison, des buts décisifs et une influence grandissante dans le jeu de son équipe.
Pour l’ASSE, actuel 16é de la Ligue 1 qui cherche à retrouver son lustre d’antan, ce recrutement pourrait être un véritable coup de maître. Le club aux dix titres de champion de France mise sur des talents prometteurs pour se reconstruire, et Ouma correspond parfaitement à cette stratégie.
Les prochains jours seront décisifs dans ce dossier. Une chose est sûre : si les Verts parviennent à boucler ce transfert, ils pourraient bien tenir là l’une des belles surprises de ce mercato hivernal.

author: Julie Salomone
title: Pasco County billboard highlights dangers of fentanyl and how it destroys families
text:
NEW PORT RICHEY, Fla. — A Pasco County mother continues to bring awareness to the dangers of fentanyl after losing her son nearly four years ago.
Tammy Plakstis worked with Fentanyl Awareness Coalition and Rachel's Angels to get a billboard up in New Port Richey on U.S. Highway 19.
Her son's face is on the billboard, along with other people, who lost their life to fentanyl poisoning.
"It's just therapeutic for me. It helps with my grief," Tammy said. "It helps me spread awareness and I wish I had the information at the time when my son died because I felt like I was all alone."
Tammy's son, Dylan, died at the age of 29. She said a dealer in New York gave him cocaine, and it was laced with fentanyl.
The billboard states, "They will not be home for Christmas. Fentanyl destroys the holidays!"
"They're not going to be home for the holidays, so we'll have an empty chair at our table because we lost our loved ones," Tammy said.
In the past, Tammy has worked to get billboards up across the Tampa Bay area, including in Tampa.
She continues to bring awareness to the dangers of fentanyl. According to the Florida Department of Health, illegally made fentanyl is cheap and it's found in street drugs like heroin, cocaine, methamphetamine and marijuana.
"My message is please be safe, don't take any pills from anyone if they're not from a pharmacy," Tammy said.
She is planning a rally on Saturday, Dec. 21. Other parents will join her. She will hand out Narcan or Naloxone.
"The parents have to do the advocating," Tammy said. "We're starting to get our voices heard. It took a lot of togetherness to do this."

author: AFP
title: Renewable electricity to outstrip coal next year: IEA - YEN.COM.GH
text: Renewable electricity to outstrip coal next year: IEA The amount of electricity produced from renewable sources worldwide is set to surpass output from coal-fired plants for the first time in 2025, the International [Energy](https://yen.com.gh/business-economy/energy/) Agency said Friday. The forecast comes as electricity demand is set to rise four percent this year and next, up from 2.5 percent in 2023. That would be the highest annual growth since 2007, excepting spikes seen after the global financial crisis that began that year and during the Covid-19 recovery, the Paris-based agency said. Soaring demand reflects "the growing role of electricity in our economies as well as the impacts of severe heatwaves," said Keisuke Sadamori, the IEA's director of energy markets and security. Hydroelectric, solar, wind and other renewable sources are forecast to provide 35 percent of global supply next year, up from 30 percent in 2023, the agency said. Solar alone is set to supply half the demand growth through 2025, with wind a further 25 percent. Coal use is not expected to decline, however, as electricity use soars in China and India in particular, the IEA said. Heatwaves across India are expected to lift electricity demand in the country by eight percent this year, while China's demand is expected to grow six percent. European demand is set to climb 1.7 percent. In the United States, where mild weather saw demand decrease last year, electricity use is set to rise three percent this year -- not least as the development of artificial intelligence spurs the creation of massive data centres. "It's encouraging to see clean energy's share of the electricity mix continuing to rise, but this needs to happen at a much faster rate to meet international energy and climate goals," Sadamori said in a statement. He also urged officials to impose higher energy efficiency standards "to reduce the impacts of increased cooling demand on power systems". author: www.ETHRWorld.com
title: Sky says 2,000 UK jobs at risk in call centre shake-up
text:
Talent Management- 1 min read
Sky says 2,000 UK jobs at risk in call centre shake-up
The British-based Sky broadcasting group said on Thursday that 2,000 jobs in the UK, or seven percent of its workforce, could be at risk as the company shakes up its customer services. "We're transforming our business to deliver quicker, simpler, and more digital customer service," a spokesperson for the US-owned broadcaster told AFP. It was about building "a future-ready Sky", the spokesperson said, adding customers wanted different ways of contacting the company 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
London-The British-based
"We're transforming our business to deliver quicker, simpler, and more digital customer service," a spokesperson for the US-owned broadcaster told AFP.
It was about building "a future-ready Sky", the spokesperson said, adding customers wanted different ways of contacting the company 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
Three of its 10 contact centres in northern England are believed to be closing, putting around 2,000 roles at risk.
While customers wanted to be able to speak directly to an adviser, they also wanted the flexibility to pay bills or manage their contract digitally, the company said.
Sky said its transformation would involve a multi-million-pound investment in its new state-of-the-art campus in Livingston, Scotland.
Formerly owned by media baron Rupert Murdoch, Sky has been run by US cable giant Comcast since 2018.
In addition to the proposed closure of the Stockport, Sheffield and Leeds Central contact centres, operations at Dunfermline and Newcastle would also be affected.

author: Belga (édité par Jâd El Nakadi)
title: JO Paris 2024 : la participation de Rafael Nadal au tournoi olympique de tennis est incertaine
text: La participation de Rafael Nadal aux Jeux Olympiques de Paris est incertaine. Le joueur espagnol de 38 ans a annulé sa séance d’entraînement avec le tennisman allemand Alexander Zverev plus tôt dans la journée en raison d’une "petite rechute", a révélé son entraîneur, Carlos Moya, à une station de radio espagnole. "Je ne peux rien garantir, il va falloir attendre", a déclaré Moyá. Le premier match de Nadal en double avec son compatriote Carlos Alcaraz est prévu pour samedi, tandis que son premier match en simple, contre le Hongrois Marton Fucsovics, est programmé dimanche. Lors de l’entraînement avec Alcaraz mercredi, Nadal portait un bandage à la cuisse droite. Moyá a précisé qu’ils devaient voir maintenant si la situation s’améliore. L’Espagnol de 38 ans a remporté la médaille d’or aux Jeux Olympiques de Pékin en 2008 et a de nouveau décroché l’or en double aux Jeux de Rio de Janeiro huit ans plus tard. Nadal se prépare à vivre ses derniers Jeux Olympiques dans le stade de Roland-Garros où il a inscrit son nom à quatorze reprises au tournoi du Grand Chelem. [Le tirage au sort](https://www.rtbf.be/article/jo-paris-2024-tennis-zizou-bergs-herite-de-tsitsipas-des-le-1er-tour-possible-nadal-djokovic-des-le-2e-tour-11409588) a décidé qu’il pourrait rencontrer l’autre star du tennis le Serbe Novak Djokovic dès le deuxième tour dans le tableau du simple.
